introduction: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:
text:
• Composer Florence Price (1887–1953) was the first African American woman to have a symphony performed by a major US orchestra.
• Her Symphony in E Minor premiered with the Chicago Symphony Orchestra in 1933.
• Price incorporated elements of African American spirituals and folk music into classical forms.
• Her work garnered critical acclaim and opened doors for other composers of color.
• Price studied at the New England Conservatory of Music.
question: The student wants to underline Florence Price’s groundbreaking achievement. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?
A: Price was an American composer who studied at the New England Conservatory of Music.
B: Florence Price’s Symphony in E Minor was performed by the Chicago Symphony Orchestra in 1933.
C: By incorporating African American spirituals, Price created a unique sound that gained critical acclaim.
D: Florence Price was the first African American woman to have a symphony performed by a major US orchestra—her Symphony in E Minor premiered in 1933 with the Chicago Symphony Orchestra.
explanation: Choice D emphasizes Price’s groundbreaking achievement (being the first African American woman with a major-orchestra performance) and cites the relevant details from the notes.
